publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1395# David Mundell: Abuse of Older and Disabled People-That the Parliament congratulates Dumfries and District Women's Aid on securing funding for a project worker to deal exclusively with women over 50 years of age and/or disabled women and notes that this is the first project of its kind in the United Kingdom; expresses its concern at the apparent increase in the abuse of older and disabled people, and believes that the Scottish Executive should support and encourage projects which seek to highlight and tackle this important issue.
S1M-1395# Abuse of Older and Disabled People (lodged on 27 November 2000) Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-1395# David Mundell: Abuse of Older and Disabled People-That the Parliament congratulates Dumfries and District Women's Aid on securing funding for a project worker to deal exclusively with women over 50 years of age and/or disabled women and notes that this is the first project of its kind in the United Kingdom; expresses its concern at the apparent increase in the abuse of older and disabled people, and believes that the Scottish Executive should support and encourage projects which seek to highlight and tackle this important issue. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Fiona McLeod*
S1M-1395# Abuse of Older and Disabled People (lodged on 27 November 2000) Donald Gorrie*
S1M-1395# Abuse of Older and Disabled People (lodged on 27 November 2000) Nora Radcliffe*, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-1395# Abuse of Older and Disabled People (lodged on 27 November 2000) Phil Gallie*, Christine Grahame*, Michael Russell*, Alex Neil*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S1M-1395# Abuse of Older and Disabled People (lodged on 27 November 2000) Alex Fergusson*, Linda Fabiani*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Keith Harding*

S1M-1395# David Mundell: Abuse of Older and Disabled People-That the Parliament congratulates Dumfries and District Women's Aid on securing funding for a project worker to deal exclusively with women over 50 years of age and/or disabled women and notes that this is the first project of its kind in the United Kingdom; expresses its concern at the apparent increase in the abuse of older and disabled people, and believes that the Scottish Executive should support and encourage projects which seek to highlight and tackle this important issue. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Fiona McLeod, Donald Gorrie, Nora Radcliffe, Ms Sandra White, Phil Gallie, Christine Grahame, Michael Russell, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram, Alex Fergusson, Linda Fabiani, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Keith Harding, Fiona Hyslop*, Mary Scanlon*
